thread.title: Commonly mispronounced words that get your blood boiling | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Commonly mispronounced words that get your blood boiling | Daily Mail Online

author: Sophie Inge For Mailonline
title: Commonly mispronounced words that get your blood boiling | Daily Mail Online
text: Share And for Mistborn_Jedi it was saying 'anyways' instead of 'anyway'. Katebandchick agreed, adding: 'I literally can't keep myself from correcting people when they do that because it grates on my ears like nails on a chalkboard.' While MechanicalHorse wrote: 'Et cetera. NOT f***ing "exetera".' But some conceded that the right pronunciation didn't always make the most sense. 'How the f*** is "Lieutenant" pronounced as "Lefftenant" that makes literally no god damn sense,' wrote A_Little_Alot. Unsurprisingly, some foreign words also featured, including the meaty Greek dish, gyro. Unsurprisingly, some foreign words also featured, including the meaty Greek dish, gyro Chipotle, the smoked chili from Mexico, also proved challenging, with many putting the 'l' in the wrong spot. 'I know loads of people who pronounce it "chip-ot-ul",' wrote DarkSideOfTheMewn. 'I'm from the UK, and it's only recently become kind of common, so there are still lots of people who have only ever seen it written and have never actually heard it pronounced properly.' For ihatemylifekillmenow it was mispronunciation of the French word 'croissant'. One user was irritated by the mispronunciation of the French word 'croissant' While Wafflesandcatss wrote: 'Espresso. THERE IS NO X. THERE IS NO NEED TO ADD ONE.' But the jury was still out on some words, with pronunciations varying from country to country. It's spelled 'Espresso' but that doesn't stop English-speakers from pronouncing the Italian coffee as 'Expresso' 'People from the U.K saying vit-a-mins,' wrote flashy_the_flash. 'Wow it bothers me.' 'Also Aussies pronounce "can't" similar to the swear word,' added Zeruvi. 'I think that's why Americans think we say it all the time.' Read more: Share or comment on this article 33
